elements.title: 1982 World's Fair (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that touch-screen technology, pay-at-the-pump, car phones, and Coca-Cola Cherry were shown at the 1982 World's Fair (pictured)?

elements.title: Yosef Shenberger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yosef Shenberger was inspired to add stained glass and other decorative elements to his synagogues through his study of ancient ruins?

elements.title: pytest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the software-testing framework pytest has been described as a key ecosystem project for the Python programming language?

elements.title: Irving L. Branch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Irving L. Branch headed the X-15 rocket program and the first test flight of the B-70 Valkyrie supersonic bomber?

elements.title: Maizbhandari (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Maizbhandari order of Sufism in Bangladesh is each year host to reportedly the fifth-largest gathering of Muslims in the world?

elements.title: Louise Janssen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Danish-born soprano Louise Janssen appeared at the Grand Théâtre de Lyon as Eva in the French premiere of Wagner's Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg?

elements.title: HMS Chichester (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that HMS Chichester was designed to carry 44 guns but never carried more than 22?

elements.title: a South Dakota radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a South Dakota radio station once played nothing but various recordings of "Amazing Grace"?
